post.body: i like the use of the word "mah"in place of "me". I picture an LOL cat every time.
you are just saying that to get attention. :)
I'm down, just as long as we are able to somehow produce something as awesome as that video.
http://vimeo.com/2317118
if you had to pick your favorite audio interface what would it be? Im looking for some inspiration.
photo evidence or it didnt happen. You have an iphone, no excuses.
is a tiny buddah covered in hair.
Sore? Or Soar (like an eagle)?
Awww shucks, I'm blushing.
I got one today too! Sweet!
Oh snap! Look who it is!
bowled tonight. Yeah that's right, you're not taking crazy pills. It actually happened and I actually halfway-kind-of enjoyed it.
is so tired and lacking in patience and grace.
: so much pie, so little time.
just wants to chill out today, doesn't really anticipate that happening.
is in a hurry fir curry. Narrowly avoided paying $30 for shabu-shabu.
needs to maintain an eternal perspective.
smetimes fantisizes about living in the 50's. Is that wierd?
: A coworker just suggested we start a massage train. I may take a "sick" day and get out of here before that happens.
: ready...steady.........GO
: God's word (the bible) has priority over tradition and precedent.
is having a night in. It pretty much never rains, so I plan on making the best of it.
has so much to process, so much to be excited about. Is so glad to be a part of church community heading in a biblical direction.
:being good at something doesn't necessarily equal liking that thing; logo design being an example that comes to mind.
: God is sooooo good to me
had a $22 lunch. Oops. Next time I'll look at the prices before I order sushi.
hopes he will be on the correct side on the day of reversals.
: love is not always lovely.
topped the evening off with a little ping pong. Man, what a great day.
played video games all day at work on the new Clover flatscreen. 2 Mortal Kombat VS DC tourneys. Needless to say, it was a very good day.
: pants are really just long, denim napkins.
is thankful for good coversation with "old" friends.
is having local business missions ideas. Don't worry if that doesn't make sense.
is pinching pennies. I haven't bought christmas presents yet and my bank account is already circling the drain.
is design jaded
estimates it taking 2 days before the loft bed causes clinical clostrophobia.
came to the 80's party dressed as an 80 year old man. I guess I didn't know what they meant.
wants the new house to feel like home.
is a school bus driver.
would like a car for Christmas. Someone make that happen.
feels that this lack of transpertarion thing is getting pretty old.
: chains he shall break for the slave is our brother and in His name all oppression shall cease.
wants to change his last name to an exlimation mark so it would read: Matt!
is enjoying his custom order sushi.
Helpful hint: When you are at Ralphs at midnight and a crazy bald man in full camo asks you questions, the answer is always "no".
is looking for a sweet laptop bag or sleeve. Suggestions welcomed.
Is trying to explain the meaning of "pwned" to some Japanese guys. This is hard.
Is the only white guy in the room. Uncomfortably awesome.
Just saw an old white lady wearing a shirt that said "I'm looking for a Japanese girlfriend" in Japanese. I wonder if she is aware?
found the Japanese new years festival, is really happy now.
is walking around little Tokyo aimlessly.
is not impressed with your trendy "too cool to introduce yourself" party. I'll take not cool, friendly people any day.
is trying to fatten himself up so that he has more motivation to exercise in 2009
wonders if he should/could get financing on a car.
: Kohls: seller of all things extra mediocre
is in shape. It may not be a toned, fit, or flattering shape.... but it's a shape.
is b o r e d.
accidentally had a pretty good (or bad) amount of caffeine. Not having fun. Might do a couple of laps around the office building.
doesn't want to be entangled in civilian persuits.
: roomate got baptized tonight. Awesome.
: grumble grumble grumble.
is bored and hungry.
is reading The Screwtape Letters again. Man, what a great book.
is on the way back to the golden state.
